Dean Wampler, Ph.D.

Polyglot Developer of Distributed, Data-centric Applications

I am a software developer specializing in Big Data applications using Spark, Hadoop, Mesos, and other tools. I’ve been a long-time advocate for Functional Programming and Scala as ideal tools for data-centric applications.

I work for Typesafe. I write books for O’Reilly. I help organize and speak frequently at conferences around the world. I organize several user groups in Chicago, where I live.

I am the author of Programming Scala, Second Edition and Functional Programming for Java Developers. I’m the co-author with Edward Capriolo and Jason Rutherglen of Programming Hive. All are published by O’Reilly Media.

My conference talks can be found at Polyglot Programming. Some are also on Slideshare.

I started the Chicago-Area Scala Enthusiasts and I help organize the Chicago Hadoop User Group and the Chicago Spark Users.

You’ll find me on Twitter and I occasionally blog.

For more on my background, see my resumé and my Linkedin account.

I inflict my photography on unsuspecting conference attendees. You can find more of it at Flickr.
